These are padded enough to protect, but also thin and light. and i can slide laterally all day and they don't slip out of place. One thing though, use only the bottom strap. take the top one off and save it as a backup. Both straps together makes the pants bunch up behind the knee and is VERY uncomfortable. one strap solves that problem. BEST pads on the market!
he says they are great
Have used these knee pads for years they are the best ones I have ever used

The knee pads themselves are constructed solidly - hard plastic with foam support and rubber strapping. They have worked well for several years and primarily used indoors on hardwood floors and bathroom tile. They would also hold up well for outdoor use.

Why only 3 stars?....well, these knee pads are not at all comfortable or ergonomic. They can only be worn over long pants (quite painful on bare skin). The rubber straps dig into my skin and are generally uncomfortable (even on top of jeans). Maybe it's because I have skinny legs, but the straps also tend to pop off the attachment studs easily.  Due to the hard plastic design, the knee pads do not flex very much (also adding to the poor wearability).

I'm on my third pair, tried a number of others like these the best.
Got both knees replaced a 15 months ago,  and kneeling is hard without padding.  I put these on in the morning and forget I have them on and knee down anytime I want.
Love em!!!!
The foam backing does wear down, I sneak in a face cloth the foam and that works fine.
You can buy extra buttons and straps for them, The buttons are hard to get in, I put them in hot water to soften them up a bit then with needle nose pliers I can pull them through.

I have bad knees.  I mean...pathetic knees.  I purchased these for use in gardening and in some painting tasks that require me to crawl on the floor (painting baseboards).  They DO offer cushion, much more than I would have had otherwise.  I liked that they had two straps since the pads with single straps in the crease of the knee cannot be comfortable.  However, both of the straps end up in the crease of the knee which is uncomfortable.  Also, for walking around from one place to another as while gardening, my knees knocked together, creating almost a tripping risk, and the pads rode down sort of pulling on the top of my kneecaps when I walked which was uncomfortable.  Due to the bulkiness of them, they were a risk going up and down ladders since they caught on each other.  If you have normal-ish knees that are not suffering from joint/cartilage/arthritis damage, they might work better.  I had higher hopes.  For some tasks where you are strictly on your knees and not moving around much, they might work well to just leave them unbuckled under your knees for cushion.
These are great!

I’ve been wearing these to install and maintain HVAC equipment for many years.
I only use the bottom strap and they stay put all day through many ups and downs.
Eventually the strap retaining buttons break off, but it’s usually about when the pads are worn thin so they’re ready for replacement anyway.
2 pairs per year average.
Small price to pay for a 30 year trade veteran with healthy knees!
These are the best knee pads - no need to look elsewhere.
I really like these.  They are most comfortable knee pads I've used.  Never liked knee pads until I used a set of these.  I ordered my own after borrowing some.
Amazing

After trying many different knee pads over the years I’ve been using these exclusively now for 6-7 years.  I never use the top strap. After years of every other day usage I’ve had 2 straps rip and strap buttons break off. Seems there is no way of repair. I’m a big man so that might factor into durability. I recommend as a solid, decent comfort, knee pad for the $$$’s. 4 stars leaves room for improvement as mentioned. Edit 5-31-22, I was mistaken for suggesting there isn’t a way to repair a broken strap button. The buttons are available for repairs. It’s not easy to push the new button through the existing hole but there is a Utube vid which explains the procedure. My new rating is 4.5 stars. leave’s room for more improvement.

I have owned these for 4 years now and they have been used a lot.  Very happy with them.  One of the strap buttons broke recently and I was able to purchase replacements, another plus.  I do wear pants, I would not wear these with shorts.

As a wood flooring contractor, I have tried many types of kneepads and these are the only ones I have found that that provide the best all around characteristics of a work knee pad for fit, feel and function.  BUT.....

First, I do cut off the top part of the pad's shell so that I only have one strap behind my knee.  Every guy that has worked for me and tried using two straps complains that there is too much strap and pants bunched up behind the knee.

What I do; starting just under the the top strap's securing knob and run the cut above and along the third ridge from one top knob to another.  This makes the knee pad lighter and leaving for one strap.  I work all day in them like this and find this is the best I can find in Knee pad design and it's practical usage. Or, just don't use the top strap.  It feels odd at first but you quickly find this is the best way to wear them, using only the lower strap.

Home Depot and Lowes just switched from carrying  the CLC to one that looks very similar.  It is close but I won't buy those types again because they have some negative characteristics.  Therefore, I came to Amazon to find The CLC pads and bought several to stock up.

I don't like the gel CLC knee pads for my work because there is too much padding inside and with all the moving around my knee tends to slide off the cushion too easily.  The gel ones are better for more stationary applications

Not A 5 star because the top strap is a negative in usage and most people think you have to use it.

I'm a home inspector, and am on my knees all day, five days per week, including bellying through crawlspaces and attics, and climbing roofs. These are the most comfortable kneepads I've found; and I no longer shop for better brands. When a pair of these wears out, I buy another pair. However, I've found I can make these last pretty much indefinitely buy buying replacement buttons. Before I knew you could repair the plastic buttons, I was going through a pair of these every six months. Now, I buy a couple packs of buttons, and whenever an old button tears off, I install a new one and keep the kneepads going for another six months.

I keep a spare pair of kneepads for convenience. It's not always possible to fix a broken button while I'm on the job. I does take a bit of effort; and it's hard do do unless you've got a heat gun or hair dryer (to soften the rubberized button holes) and pair of needle nose pliers to pinch the buttons through the holes. But once you get the hang of it, its' easy.

I'm a big fan of these! Five stars, plus!
Stay in place and comfort
Comfortable, ergonomic design, stay up when walking around, durable, gentle on me and the work surfaces. Rubber straps cracked after a year.

The weakest link on these pads is the semi-soft rubber knobs that the rubber support bands attach to.  These should be made of a durable plastic but, because they are fabricated from semi-soft rubber, they break off at the shaft.  I replaced them all on each pad with a component made of a combination of one 1/4"-20 flat head elevator bolt

I don't think the industry has yet figured out the perfect knee pad.which is shocking because There is need. Kneed?
These aren't the soft distort of the most comfortable on the knees. But they are the most useful in the since that they don't slide down when you're not actively using them. They don't move around on your knee when you are planted on the ground. And they generally last long enough to get your money's worth.
There are new pads of similar style which are just as good.but this is the style. Deviate too far away from this style of knee pad and they either slipped down or wear out or slide around on the knee.

* You can generally find these cheaper in person at the hardware store.
Husband had some similar and didn't want any other style. So happy to find these.
Had an old pair for years.  These fit the bill perfectly for my old knees.
These never slip down the leg.  Also work really well.

the vynal nylon knee pads although built a lot better are not safe for anything other than as sports pads-they are too slippery-THESE Kneepads have lots of grip and very rugged - but are short lived and they need better strappings. untill i find actual better. this set is my "go to set"" and NOT ""just for kids"""

The design of these kneepads is revolutionary. They stay put on your knees. They are easily adjustable over a wide range and very comfortable to wear. I have used them on flat driveways as well as stone driveways with no loss in comfort level.

These have good cushion if you’re not constantly on your knees. My job doesn’t require me to be on my knees constantly, only ever so often but when I am it’s all day. These provide enough support that my knees don’t hurt. Unlike other knee pads these are flexible enough to still be able to walk like a normal person and allow you to bend your knee. They are not stiff at all. You do have to be carful not to pull on the straps too hard, they do feel a little flimsy and sometimes a strap will come off on occasion when working. Happy with my purchase
I have used these for 15 years.  I have to replace every eight months because I take them on and off so much with my work.  The little button breaks off  But the are great cushion for my knees

The headline kind of says it all.  I have had several different kinds of knee pads and the downside to all of them is when you are wearing shorts the straps are hard on the backside of your legs where the straps are.  I've been kneeling on hard work surfaces for 40 years so these are knee savers.  They will eventually get uncomfortable as anything would.  The material they are made of also helps as you don't have to tighten them super tight so they don't slip down.  It is a soft rubber with no rough edges.

Great value, last a long time.
As expected and for a good deal.
They do the job of taking off material and, though we tend to use one small area more than the whole strip, it's holding up well.
Great sandpaper for a good price, cant go wrong
working great...
Hope the hold up well.
These work well
I have used these belts previously and have been fully satisfied with their performance.  Buying them in a 10 pack makes them a value buy.
Great price. Fast delivery. Good quality.
Good coarse pad for initial material removal.
It is a good quality sanding product.  Arrived in a timely fashion.  Fits my sander.  I would recommend this product.
Look good but time will tell,
